intro: Senecio cuencanus, commonly known as the Cuencan ragwort, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly found in Argentina and Chile. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showing adaptations to dry conditions such as reduced leaf size and deep root systems. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, and it produces small, wind-dispersed seeds. Senecio cuencanus is often found in rocky or sandy soils, thriving in regions with low precipitation.
